intro: Aquilegia dahurica, commonly known as the Siberian columbine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountains of Central Asia. It features striking, spurred flowers that range in color from blue to purple, with five petals and two elongated nectar guides. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with compound leaves divided into three to five lobes. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, often found in alpine and woodland environments. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
